messages.content: Cheating only exists through one card and a potion.
Collector has Scorch and Deathmarked.
There's Chain Lash on Champ.

I've found this card to be pretty usable, but I do tend to bias towards fat gremlin focused decks, as I find the weak to be extremely valuable to reduce the risk of a death spiral on gremlins. Cripple can be useful in two different ways. The first is in a deck that doesn't actually apply very much weak (more focused on having other gremlins in the front), so that 1 stack can last a whole fight. The other way is in a deck very focused on spamming attacks with fat gremlin to make it into a pseudo poison effect, where it provides constant ticking damage for all the stacks you've built up, and also lets you focus more on defense at that point if you want to. To be fair, neither of those is outstanding, and the damage on this is well below par otherwise. It's also a rare, and there are other, stronger rares for gremlins most of the time. I would be hard pressed to buy this at a shop unless I was really struggling for persistent damage in a fat gremlin focused deck, though I think it's plenty takeable from hallway fights, and can be a solid pick from boss rewards if you fit either of the 2 mentioned categories. Both target wounds and broken shin are better rare support cards for a weak focused deck, but this is still useful. Making it so that weak doesn't decrease can help you land a stronger burly blow.

It's usually pretty easy to remove artifact charges as gremlins (especially in decks focused on using fat) so breaking artifact on enemies to land this is usually pretty doable. Scales well over the course of the run, since fights both get longer, and enemies deal more damage, which gets further reduced by weak. I think this plays quite well in acts 3 and 4, though it will usually be pretty underwhelming in act 1. The upgrade is nice at a +4, but since this exhausts, you shouldn't really be prioritizing it over more permanent upgrades.

iirc cripple stacks ? So if you necronomicon the attack your "poison weak" deals twice as much damage.
I don't like it when a card makes a  new mechanic represented through powertext and you only see it on that card exclusively and no where else
people say this card is bad
they are understating how unusable this is

this card costs 2 energy, in order to do more damage later based on how much weak you have on the enemy. Meanwhile another card <burly blow> costs the same and will just kill the enemy far quicker; used in the exact same strategy and is of a lower rarity
